body:
> One slight nitpick: Could you please move the `jsf_editor_api_location` into the `build` dir? That way all temporary artifacts are there. You can also drop `jsf_editor_api_target_location` if you directly build the zip file without copying files. The zip task can handle excludes itself and supported embedded filesets.

@matthiasblaesing , You're right. We can drop the `jsf_editor_api_target_location` and directly build the zip file without copying the files. I have done that and moved the `jsf_editor_api_location` into the `build` dir in the latest commit.

I found some of the schemas:
- org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-ws-policy:3.2.6
- org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-ws-rm:3.2.6
- org.apache.cxf:cxf-core:3.2.6
I think I never saw ws-trust in the CXF files.
Than you Sarvesh. Merging.

> Thank you - while investigating the version difference between the `servlet-api` and the `jsp-api` dependcy, I noticed, that the `jsp-api` is not used. The code in `serversrc` only depends on the `servlet-api`.
> 
> For the `servlet-api-6.0.13-license.txt` please add a `Type: compile-time` header.
> 
> With these changes I think this is good to be merged.

Changed incorporated in last commit
by-mistake clicked the "comment & close" button
I screwed the merged - it should have been a squashed before. Sorry.
Thank you - looks good.

Thanks - I'll start with the ALv2 files. You have an ICLA on file so I assume, that, as an Oracle employee, you are in a position to donate the new files. Having written this, you don't need to add the files to the `licenseinfo.xml` please just add the ASF header to the four files and remove the entries in the file.

I noticed, that several of the DTDs don't include a incomplete/missing/wrong license headers. These look like artifacts from when the files were first imported. I looks as if Oracle/Sun got better with this is recent times and the glassfish project distributes:

https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/glassfish/main/appclient/gf-client-module/5.0/gf-client-module-5.0.jar

There the DTDs and XSDs contain sane license information. It would be good to replace the files with fresh copies. The `static-verification_1_4.dtd` file is not in there, but I would replace that with the version from the glassfish repository you already referenced.
How will syntax highlighting work? I mean how to get it from the LS @jlahoda?
Not supported yet by LSP: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/pull/367

The simple answer is that the LSP does not support highlighting at this point. So no highlighting through the LSP. See for example:
https://github.com/eclipse/lsp4j/issues/40

This may get into the protocol eventually, see:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/pull/367
Ok, thx.
@phansson what needs to get it done? Any big issues?

Any other feedback for this ? One negative comment, no other opinions - I've originally though that disguising PNGs as GIFs is rather a hack, but if it is the preferred way, I'll cancel the PR.

@neilcsmith-net  I admit that I don't exactly understand what "pluggable branding provider" - perhaps should be discussed in more detail on mailing list or described in Wiki, sounds like a more complex "layer on top" of the base distribution.

@matthiasblaesing , I have made the following changes in the latest commit : 
- I have made fixes to build.xml and the build works fine now
- The notice files in struts libraries contained the same text which was also equal to the NOTICE.txt present in `struts-1.3.10-lib.zip`, so I created a NOTICE.txt in the external folder

The web.struts-external-resources.zip file was created during the last donation by combining the contents from `src/org/netbeans/modules/web/struts/resources/` folder, but some configuration files also got roped in which were specific to the resources that were being used. So, I have added the following files directly to `src/org/netbeans/modules/web/struts/resources/` with Apache-2.0 license header

- struts.xml
- struts-config.xml
- validation.xml
- tiles-defs.xml
- struts-config_1_2.mdd
- welcome.jsp

Other than the aforementioned files, there were two more files present in `struts-1.3.10-lib.zip`, : 
- struts-config_1_2-custom.dtd
- struts-config_1_3-custom.dtd

I think that these custom files were derived from struts-config_1_2.dtd and struts-config_1_3.dtd respectively, but I am not really sure about it. So, should we go ahead and add these two files with Apache-2.0 license? 
Also, does the overall approach for this module seem fine?
@rtaneja1 , Could you please take a look at this too?

Changes look fine to me, please make sure test results are same as before changes. Also run ant -Dcluster.config=full verify-libs-and-licenses to check that there are no warnings in this module. 
Not sure about license for struts-config_1_2-custom.dtd, struts-config_1_3-custom.dtd, not included in this PR?

I see a few problems - I pushed an updated branch here:

https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/tree/github-pr-940

- Use the declarative method for copying files and let the build system do the work
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/aadd5122b4ceac942ef9e5eba1fb1bc6a1d1f82c
- Include DTD/XML/TLD files with correct license attribution 
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/463af8c90453e028a12e214d03333024d5249555
If you just extract the DTD/XML/TLD files, you won't get the license information. From the perspective of the build system the external dependency is not used and as such the license/notice is not included. My change moves the license information into the `licenseninfo.xml` file where it can be extracted from. 
- The referenced libraries are almost all Apache libraries and normally they come with NOTICE files, which we are required to analyse and if appropriate include in our NOTICE file. Just adding the `NOTICE.txt` in `external` does not work, as the build system won't promote the file into build binaries. The build system was enhanced to pick up a `<basename>-notice.txt` file, if it would pick up a `<basename>-license.txt` file and include the contents of that file into the final netbeans NOTICE file. I removed the javadoc license files and replaced them with a `Files` header in the main artifact license file. For `antlr` the license is not correct. ANTLR _2_ is public domain and a matching license file is already present in the `nbbuild/licenses` directory. These changes are committed as: https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/81878a431221da0f801dccca9f2bda797539dddb
- The struts javadoc does not need to be rebuild everytime `build-init` is called. It was be conditionalized and moved to embedded `zipfileset`s instead of expanding the zip and rezipping them: https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/3daed9b79b2fc7810c9744af743501079a77550f

In the second commit above I also rebuild `struts-config_1_3-custom.dtd`. It is trivially derived from `struts-config_1_3.dtd`, the process is described in the document itself. This also fixed a build failure, as without `struts-config_1_3-custom.dtd` the build just does not work. The license for that file than results from the original file.

The `web-app_2_3.dtd` is not referenced and thus removed from the codebase.

For below 3 files ,old files were checked in as with latest available file, schema generation is failing. 
  sun-resources_1_3.dtd 
 glassfish-ejb-jar_3_1-1.dtd
 glassfish-resources_1_5.dtd
Rest files are taken from either https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/glassfish/main/appclient/gf-client-module/5.0/gf-client-module-5.0.jar or https://github.com/javaee/glassfish.git repo except the below
 sun-ejb-jar_3_0-1.dtd(http://www.sun.com/software/appserver/dtds/sun-ejb-jar_3_0-1.dtd)
I agree with matthiasblaesing here: "If you start netbeans from a shell, I like to see output from the called programm." But this patch reverses that? What's the rationale for this?

The compile errors come from `Schema2Beans`. It turns out, that `Schema2Beans` fails if entity declarations span more than one line in a DTD. I'm looking into improving `Schema2Beans`, so that at least basic support for multiline entities is possible.

What is the status of this PR. If it is ready then let;s merge it!
Since NB 10.0 vc1 vent out without launcher script update, we might consider this one cherry picked into release100 branch and release the next vc with this.

Please have a look at:
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/tree/github-pr-958

The two commits:
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/7ce419135d42aad0e4a42b99c6dbd89b38eaa5b1
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/commit/d5608f2ba35f8e0b18e7f7d2bb3daa229a19751b

fix Schema2Beans for parsing files with entities and especially files with multi line entity definitions.

This PR is ready to merge.

But as far as I know, simply updating the source files do not cause the new EXE files to be included in the new NetBeans distro (I assume that's what https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1145 will fix). Is there some manual step we need to take in addition, to locally build the EXE files, and include them in the repo or some external location? Do we actually put EXE files somewhere in the repo?
This commit is ready to merge if no one objects to the addition of the "VectorIcon" class to the public API of org.openide.awt module.
Merged and cherry picked into release100. AFAIK the launchers now is in the repo as a zip file. I'm going to update that as well, till NETBEANS-1145 solves this issue.
Closed in favor of PR #883.
Well the launcher is downloaded from out external resource, so I'll ask @jlahoda to update them for 10.0 and master as well. He kindly did that for 9.0.
There is no reason for this change. The license header is ok, as it is.

Thanks! There's another bug that will require a launcher rebuild:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1308

But I'm not sure how to fix that one.

@matthiasblaesing can we use "LGPL-2.1" license for dtd files?
Unsure as to why the Travis CI build failed, as I ran and passed all tests on my machine.  @matthiasblaesing any ideas to point me in the right direction to repair the issue?  Thanks

@sarveshkesharwani I created a squashed version with my suggestions applied:
https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/incubator-netbeans/tree/github-pr-940-2
You are credited as the author, I'll be present as committer. If you agree with the changes, I'll merge the changes to master as presented in the above referenced branch. in that process I would also let github close this PR.

For `struts-config_1_3-custom.dtd`: Yes for me the build failed. I think I know what happend: You did a build with the file present, removed the file and rebuild. This could have worked, if the build system did not detect changes, it would not try to rebuild the generated classes and it would look like building without the file succeeded. I ran the build after running `git clean -f -x -d` which basicly removes everything not part of the repository.

@juneau001 I'll start with your build error - lets start how to see it:
- Click on "details" behind the travis check - you now get to the travis-ci web interface
- Click on the failing job - you'll see the normal output (incomplete)
- Click on "Raw log" - you'll get to: https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/441151558/log.txt
- Now look for "Build failed" and you'll get:

```
travis_time:start:00449ade
^[[0K$ if [ "x$LICENSE" == "xtrue" ]; then ant -quiet verify-libs-and-licenses -Dverify-libs-and-licenses.haltonfailure=true; fi
     [echo] Bootstrapping NetBeans-specific Ant extensions...
     [echo] Downloading external binaries (*/external/ directories) for cluster.config=release...
[verifylibsandlicenses] Warning: org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser: Property 'http://www.oracle.com/xml/jaxp/properties/entityExpansionLimit' is not recognized.
[verifylibsandlicenses] Compiler warnings:
[verifylibsandlicenses]   WARNING:  'org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl: Property 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/property/accessExternalDTD' is not recognized.'

BUILD FAILED
/home/travis/build/apache/incubator-netbeans/nbbuild/build.xml:1532: Failed VerifyLibsAndLicenses test(s):
Some licenseinfo.xml files failed verification:
enterprise/j2ee.dd/licenseinfo.xml referenced file not found 'src/org/netbeans/modules/j2ee/dd/impl/resources/java_web_services_client_1_1.xsd'
```

You can get the full check on your system by running:
```
ant -Dcluster.config=enterprise verify-libs-and-licenses
```
from the root of the repository. The output can be found in: `nbbuild/build/verifylibsandlicenses.xml`. Look only for failures referencing the module you are working on.

Long story short: Your `licenseinfo.xml` references a file, that is not present.

The build failure is IMHO minor - a bigger problem is, that your `licenseinfo.xml` makes invalid license claims.

- You need to create one fileset per license/comment tuple and I think this is the main problem.
- You imported the XSDs. Most, if not all, DTDs/XSDs Oracle/Sun created for Open Source projects are dual-licenses as GPLv2-CPE/CDDL. For the Apache Netbeans Project we elect the CDDL as the license. Yet the file declares: `<license ref="Apache-2.0-ASF" />`. You need to check the individual files (they all should contain a license statement), but most probably are GPLv2-CPE/CDDL-1.1 and thus a correct entry would be `<license ref="CDDL-1.1" />` for these.
- you declare `<comment type="COMMENT_UNSUPPORTED"/>` that is correct for the `doc/dd_api_schema.jpg` file. The comment should give a reasoning why the file can/needs to be included. For the schemas we include them because we use the schemas at runtime for XML validation and code completion. The CDDL can be included (https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-b, last paragraph). The prepared comment for that is "CATEGORY-B". If you read the FAQ entry the name becomes clear :-)

So please:
- check the files if valid license headers/license info is present, if not please try to find a good copy (for the standard a good source is:https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.main.appclient/gf-client-module/5.0/glassfish-jar, for W3C files please look on the W3C site)
- If the file is from the W3C, the license is most probably `W3C-2` (the current version of the W3C software license). Please see `enterprise/web.core/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/taglib/resources/xml.xsd` and `enterprise/web.core/licenseinfo.xml` for a sample. I added the license header to the file and documented that inline.
- The JavaEE XSDs normally have valid headers (see discussion about license above). It just needs to be checked, that it is ok.
- Group the files by license and comment and add `fileset` entries for each group of file to `licenseinfo.xml`

Thanks for the detailed information @matthiasblaesing  I was not aware of the requirements for the licenseinfo.xml file, so this is great information!  I will make the requested changes and repair the issue that is causing the failure.  I certainly appreciate it!
Laszlo, would you be OK with this for NB 10.0. Would be quite helpful. Thanks!
Can't we download these XSD's, just like we're downloading JARs that we can't include/distribute either?
@lkishalmi  don't know for whom this question is, but I think there is no problem to merge this.
Let's restart build after PR #971 is merged.
@matthiasblaesing, I took your changes and built the module, everything works just fine. There are no verification errors either. I think we can merge it. Thank you for your help!

This is just an assert exception, so need not  to do it. However, we already know that the command for the latest stable version is not available. So we should avoid using it, I thought. Should we just check the LTS by default?

> This is just an assert exception, so need not to do it. However, we already know that the command for the latest stable version is not available. So we should avoid using it, I thought. Should we just check the LTS by default?

I see. Frankly, I do not know :) I would need to investigate the current state of Symfony, the current state of its support in NetBeans (do we handle correctly Symfony 3 projects? What about Symfony 4 as I can see it is the latest version?). In other words, I would expect that the next LTS version will stop working as well; or am I wrong? :)

The latest stable version seems Symfony 4. We have to install it via composer. i.e. We can install only Symfony 3 (LTS)projects using the installer. (see the attatched above image) Currently, we don't provide support for Symfony 4 yet...(I don't know if it works fine without changes.)

Exactly. So this change will work unless Symfony project starts creating Symfony 3 LTS projects using `composer` :) That will not happen I guess so we can merge. Of course, Symfony 4 needs to be investigated whether the current support can be extended or a new module should be created.

I will merge this MR once the build passes.

Thanks!
Thank you for checking - I just merged the changeset, so closing this.

Cherry picked to release100 as bd30bf252

It depends, but for gif there is no reason nowadays to use it anymore. No transparency (Only 1 or 0, but not in between), less colors, etc. So PNG is the better choice, as you can see it for the SplashScreen (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1444).

It would be nice if we can handle SVG as icons too, that would be a big enhancement. But this is another topic.
And if we can have a performance impact at the startup, that would be also great.
The build passed :)
So merged :)

Fixed.
- Set labelFors
- Set some component's text properties using Plain text

Thanks!
Why closed ? The issue seems relevant and code including tests looks good ?
Why closed ? The issue seems relevant and code including tests looks good ?

I closed the previous PR because there were two isolated aspects included. The eager logic is covered by this PR. The other aspect is about the contract of autoload in the context of fragmented hosts:
* Should a fragment (not eager/autoload) trigger the enabling of the host ( in case host is autoload) because host must be loaded before fragment and fragment is a "default" module which means the module system should load it? -> To avoid this fragment must be autoload or eager.
* Should a fragment (autoload) be loaded by the module system if host is loaded in case no one depends on it? -> Contract of autoload is broken (or different for fragments)

For me it is not clear at the moment what is right. The only thing I can say  is that tests I have written against 9 are broken with 10. May be the scope of these tests is to small and overall every thing is fine. So I excluded this aspect.

The contract of fragments was underspecified, it seems. The original idea (and still a requirement) was to supplement other module's code to satisfy (mostly legacy) dependencies (the `compat8` auto-injected dependencies were the first users of Fragment feature). For this, it is sufficient that autoload fragment loads only on demand. BUT since the hosting module's classloader is actually extended by fragment's contents, delayed load (after a depending module is enabled) causes entire IDE restart, as the classloader may have linked some classes in a different way not having the fragment loaded.

I think it is good to idea to mark fragments `eager` to distinguish between the two cases. So let's have `autoload` fragments to load on demand with a possible IDE restart and `eager` fragments to attach early and prime the system. This also means that 'autoload' fragments may not fail silently (at least log) but `eager` failures should be treated just as other unsatisfied dependencies - this PR fixes that.

`autoload` scenario should also satisfy `nbjavac` case, where the fragment is `OpenIDE-Module-Required`, so triggered by `java.source.nbjavac` module - correct, @jlahoda  ?

So my answers to your questions:
1. yes, a non-eager/autoload (= manually controlled) fragment should enable its host. 
2. no, such fragments should be marked `eager`

/cc: @jlahoda

I'm not a groovy expert, but:

- visited the some of the completion changes and they look sane
- visited infrastructure changes and they also look sane

Changes for following xsd files:
1. oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd -> Taken from cxf-rt-ws-policy-3.2.6.jar
2. ws-securitypolicy-1.2.xsd -> Taken from cxf-rt-ws-policy-3.2.6.jar
3. ws-securitypolicy.xsd -> W3C license added
4. wsrmp-1.2-schema-200702.xsd -> Replace with wsrmp-1.1-schema-200702.xsd i.e taken from cxf-rt-ws-rm-3.2.6.jar
5. wsrm-policy.xsd-> Taken from cxf-rt-ws-rm-3.2.6.jar
6.WS-Trust.xsd -> Remove the xsd file, http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/02/trust/ws-trust.xsd license is not appropriate. OASIS license require.
7. ws-trust-1.3.xsd -> Remove the xsd file, OASIS license require
8. wsat.xsd -> License is added in header file (https://github.com/javaee/metro-wsit/blob/master/wsit/ws-tx/wstx-services/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/wsdl/wsat.xsd)

Note:
1. There is no compile errors with these changes.
2. Removing of ws-trust*.xsd files may cause error in functionality.

@matthiasblaesing  Please provide your comment on the above changes.

Sure, can you please share sample project where this issue is reproducible.
For debugging, if you have built NB10 and running using ant tryme, run with -Ddebug.port=portnum and open the sources in another NetBeans instance. Invoke Debug - Attach Debugger (SocketAttach, same port).

Thx... will try to debug later.

How I reproduced:
- checkout nbm-maven-plugin from its internet repo
- open AbstractNbmMojo.java
- arround line 260, inside an if statement, start typing 'log.'
- code completion popup is shown
- now type (add) 'debug' and wait
- the code completion popup should now only show three possible options
- make sure the first item in the popup has focus ( log.debug(CharSequence ) 
- press enter
- now the exception has occured with exact same stacktrace
Is this really a solution to prevent a SOE? I mean, why does this happen?

I agree, but this exception has been reported multiple times, without providing the exact .js code snippet that is causing issue.  The code causing the SOE was added for goto support which IMO is nice to have.
I think this PR needs a really deep look whether this will not causing other side effects.

Thanks a lot for working on this, Reema!
I think that we should use this solution to just leave a log. Otherwise, it means that we just ignore the bug. I don't think it is good...

I guess that a reporter could not provide an example code because the reporter could not find a file which has a problem. So it is significant to leave the log, I think.

BTW, if the static field is accessed from multiple threads at the same time, it can be an incorrect value? Instead, we should use a method parameter? Am I wrong?

Thank you for the updated PR. In general this looks good. I noticed this:
- `web-app_2_2.dtd` is declared as originate from the W3C. I doubt that. Judging from the other descriptors, I would replace it with a copy from here: `https://www.jcp.org/j2ee/dtds/web-app_2_2.dtd` and adjust the `licenseinfo.xml` accordingly
- `web-app_2_3.dtd` looks strange (the license is unconventional) - this copy hold a cleaner license: https://www.jcp.org/dtd/web-app_2_3.dtd. 

Both files can also be found in the following glassfish artifact:
https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.main.appclient/gf-client-module/5.0/glassfish-jar
Given that oracle was the distributor/developer of glassfish this would be a safe source. With these files updated, I would merge.
Still unable to reproduce this exception, tried in Windows 7, Linux 7, both Jdk 10 and JDK8 , nb-javac plugin version 1.5.

Thank you for fixing it!
I've verified that SOE does not occur with this change :)

During debugging, I noticed that the line numbers in the exception appear to be confusing...the debugger stepped into whitespace here and there....as if some optimization is done by the compiler or vm...

I also noticed that during the handling of the 'accept', when the exception is shown, that cancelling the exception causes the correct code to be completed, even the parameter name is correct..

So what I will look into some time is, if the last piece of the execution stack should actually not be executed to prevent the problem....

I just tested with Darcula on both Windows and MacOS. Darcula is unaffected, except for the non-LAF specific icons (arrow, toolbar_arrow_horizontal/vertical), which do get applied to Darcula as well. Those will need some more contrast on dark themes; I can take care of that in a separate commit.

Looking at Darcula, its LAF icons seem to be based on the Windows 8 theme. So it should be fairly easy to adapt this work to that plugin. But that would have to be done on the Darcula side. Separate work would also have to be done to vectorize icons on whichever LAF is the default on Linux.

Yes, branding attempts that replace the PNGs but not the LAF identifier will be thwarted by this commit. I think that's OK, except for the contrast issue noted above.

I'll merge this patch and start creating some issues for future HiDPI work.

Regardless of what we do with the other sites touched by https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/4b82e6adb31e294c74fd2fa99779ce9e27ae6184 , this patch still applies, and has been reviewed, so I'll merge it.
Fixed dark theme appearance for the three LAF-independent icons at https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/8f1f57bdc2552541b9947fd12ac8dd74796539f6 . Tested on Darcula on Windows.
Created an issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-1583 for the future, once we eventually want to update ImageUtilities to work with MultiResolutionImage instances.

Can you please provide JDK version and nb-javac plugin version used in your environment. If debugger is stepping into whitespace, then your source is likely out of sync with the runtime jar. 
I'm closing this PR as this breaks the code completion.
